intro: Ruellia willdenoviana, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of blue to violet flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Ruellia willdenoviana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
